file_content.text: I apologize for everything on Dromund Kaas... but I still believe we should unite your people with mine.
You've proven yourself, Acina. I accept your offer.
I agree. Let's ally.
That doesn't mean you're home free. We're watching you.
At the first sign of treachery, the deal's off--and there will be retribution.
My thoughts exactly.
I would expect nothing less.
I look forward to working with you.
Mayday! Mayday! This is the cargo freighter Ridala. Does anybody copy?
This is Koth Vortena aboard the Gravestone. We got your back, Ridala. You okay?
We've taken heavy damage. Need to make emergency repairs.
Roger that, Ridala.
We'll bring your freighter on board. Just hold tight.
Much appreciated, Koth. Looking forward to meeting you in person.
I can't take that risk, Acina. The Alliance moves forward alone.
No deal.
Enough. If this is going to work, we all need to trust each other.
Quiet, Theron.
Knowing Theron, not even your HoloNet activity is safe.
He's not kidding.
I hope to prove you can count on the Empire.
Remind me to change my access codes.
I understand. I hope we never find ourselves on opposite ends of the battlefield.
Not that I'm complaining, but why did you refuse her?
The Sith Empire is broken. They're too weak to be of any value.
The Sith are useless.
I only hope we don't come to regret this. In times like these, we need all the allies we can get.
I've known the Sith Empire too long to trust them.
The Empire isn't trustworthy.
If the Alliance hopes to succeed, we need to break free of the Empire and Republic.
We can't limit ourselves.
Despite everything, they're still the Sith Empire. I could never fully trust them.
I, uh... right. Sorry, Commander.
